text: Hey everyone! I believe related_blog_posts is new, I'm pretty sure up until last month there was a workaround on this link, so that's cool :slightly_smiling_face: Anyway, I wanted to ask if anyone knows of a quick way of checking if there are no related posts, like {% if !related_blog_posts %} {% if related_blog_posts.count == 0 %}. Thanks! <https://designers.HubSpot.com/tutorials/creating-a-related-post-listing>
<@U7AS8L4MR> on it! - thanks for the heads up

<@UBUNBSM24> try putting the logic and markup in the functionâ€™s macro
```{% macro blog_post_formatter(blog_post, index, count) %}
    {% if count > 0 %} formatted related post markup here
    {% else %} there are no related posts here
    {% endif %}
{% endmacro %}```
Okay <@U7SL518D6> <@U2H3TT8F2> Thanks! I will use the api. But there is no way to use server side code in HubSpot?
Yep, I see how the macro is really convenient to customise the HTML as well. My bad for skim reading. Thanks again!

With it being a SAAS platform, we don't have access to use server side code that makes the platform run. HubL is the closest thing you will get to using server-side code. You may be able to use some other Jinja based items (<http://jinja.pocoo.org/docs/2.10/>) and while they may work, they are not officially supported and could go away at anytime.
<@U2H3TT8F2> Thanks for sharing buddy! Have a nice day!
Is there a way to exclude a specific category from this loop?
